p: Endometriosis is very challenging to treat. The management of endometriosis could be surgical or conservative [ 15]. The most commonly used therapeutic agents are nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAID) and hormonal medication for repressing the ovarian function, such as oral contraceptives, gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonists, selective progesterone receptor modulators, androgens, or aromatase inhibitors [ 16]. Aromatase inhibitors, GnRH antagonists, anti-tumor necrosis factor- α (TNF-α), antiangiogenic factors and selective progesterone receptor modulators are the newest medical therapies for endometriosis [ 17]. These hormonal treatments have various side effects and usually they are not fully effective [ 18]. In addition to the drug therapy, the surgical resection is used in order to remove the detectable ectopic sites of endometriosis, leading to improved fertility, and complete or partial pain relief. However, the reoccurrence of the endometriotic lesions is still possible [ 19].
